intro: Sceletium archeri, commonly known as the "Kalahari tobacco" or "Kalahari weed," is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its leaves contain psychoactive compounds, including kynurexanthine and harmine, which have been traditionally used by indigenous communities. Sceletium archeri is also known for its medicinal and cultural significance in the region.
